Talk62:
<sp:3:0:2:0100>With your help, President Hudson is now
standing proudly and firmly in place!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0801>It fills my heart with joy to see him doing
so well on his own.
Talk14:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>All right! Time to go back to Tarrey Town
and tell Mr. Hudson the good news!
Talk63:
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:Happy>These portray Mr. Hudson himself in
detail窶馬oble, glorious detail!
Talk20:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Did you do that?!


<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thanks! Who knew there was such a
clever way to offer a helping hand!
Talk21: <sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:Scare><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>W-will he be OK? He won't fall?<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk22:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>And that's to put up these signs all over
the place to let everyone know that
Hudson Construction is a big deal.
These aren't your ordinary signs, as you
can clearly see.
Talk24:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But I can't stand here forever. I've got so
many more signs to spread around!

I don't know what to do...
Talk26:
<clr:0200><sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Tired><sp:0:2:2:5000>All right...<sp:5:1:0> I'm sorry, President Hudson! <sp:5:0:0>I won't
let you fall over again!<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk28:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01>Oh, right! Let's get him secured while
he's still standing!
Talk29: <sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0801>Don't worry, Mr. Hudson. I'm here for you!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk30: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Just put this right there... Get that fastened, and...<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk31:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>What is it? <sp:5:0:0>I need to stay focused.
President Hudson might topple over if
I don't give him my full support!
So, er, can you not bother me?
Talk33:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>President Hudson <sp:5:0:0>is THE visionary who
had material caches placed all over
the land.
<sp:3:0:2:0100>Everyone is welcome to use those
building materials. You, too, of course.
Help yourself.
Just remember to say it loud and proud窶能n"Thank you, Mr. Hudson! Thank you for all
you do!"
Talk34:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>President Hudson <sp:5:0:0>is the brilliant founder
of Tarrey Town! Be sure to visit if you go
to Akkala.
<sp:3:0:2:0100>It's such a nice, homey place that you
might not be able to bring yourself
to leave.
Talk35:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>President Hudson <sp:5:0:0>is more or less a genius
when it comes to making anything. Signs
of all kinds? Easy.
You name it, he can make it. Houses, no
problem. Ingeniously detailed figures?
Oh, yes. That too.
<sp:3:0:2:0100>This whole sign, by the way, is my own
work. I'm nowhere nearly as skilled as
President Hudson...
Still, I'm happy with how it turned out!
Talk36: <sp:3:0:2:0800>Oh, it's you! Thanks for your help earlier.
Talk37:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>That was unforgivable!<sp:5:1:0> It's all your fault,
startling me like that!
Talk38:
<sp:3:0:2:0901>Yes, I know it's just a sign. But I have
great respect for President Hudson!
So, I pin the blame on you...
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><snd:Angry>Un-for-givable!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk41:
<sp:3:0:2:0000>Ah! What am I doing, blathering on?<sp:5:1:0>
Don't worry, President Hudson! You
have my full attention!
Talk42:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Oh, but maybe that's not enough?
Here's a little something extra...
Talk43:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>Ah, but that hardly conveys my gratitude.
Let me give you this too!
Talk44:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>You haven't heard about Mr. Hudson?!


<sp:3:0:2:0101>He's the president of our construction
company! He's THE one appointed by
THE princess herself!
CompTalk01:
<sp:3:0:2:0400><snd:SurpriseS>Ah, it's you!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100>Thank you for helping me put up all those
President Hudson signs.<sp:0:4:0>I meant to get back to town right away,
but I was drawn in by the sweet sounds
of the Stable Trotters.
They're such great performers, I just have
to listen to enough of their music to give
President Hudson a full report!
<sp:3:0:2:0200>So I'm not slacking off. I'm carrying out
a very important mission!
Talk45:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>She placed him in charge of putting those
material caches everywhere. And now he's
shouldering Hyrule's restoration!
CompTalk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:QuestionNormal>Hm? What do you want? <sp:5:0:0>I'm trying to
marvel at President Hudson's窶能u003csp:0:4:0>Er, <sp:5:1:0>that is, Bandleader Mastro's rousing
and masterful conducting.<sp:0:4:0>So could you not bother me?
Talk46:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>Of course, he is also the founder of
Hudson Construction, and besides
all that...
CompTalk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:QuestionNormal>What? What is it? <sp:5:0:0>Can't you see I'm
getting lost in President Hudson's窶能u003csp:0:4:0>Er, <sp:5:1:0>I mean, Violynne's beautiful timbre?!<sp:0:4:0>So could you not pull me out of the
performance like that?
Talk47:
<sp:3:0:2:0900>Hey! <sp:5:0:0>I'm right in the middle of President
Hudson's epic tale of heroism!<sp:5:1:0>

Well, fine. <sp:5:0:0>What was I doing before?
I don't want the others getting jealous,
so I haven't spread this around...
<sp:3:0:2:0100>But President Hudson gave me an
extra-special mission.
CompTalk04:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000><snd:LaughS>The way they play is so incredible, I almost forget
that it's raining.<sp:0:4:0>How I wish President Hudson could hear this...<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
CompTalk05:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>What do you think you're doing?!
Listening to the Stable Trotters in such
lacking attire is unforgivable!
<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0900>Un-for-givable!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0>Come back when you've put on some
proper clothes!
Talk50:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I will give him my full support as always.
No wind or rain will get in my way!
Talk02:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:QuestionNormal_00>What?! <sp:5:0:0>Are you going to support him?
All right.<sp:5:0:0> I'll let go!
CompTalk06:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:TalkPositive>Oh, hello. We meet again. Thanks for your
help putting up those signs.<sp:0:4:0>The Stable Trotters put on some amazing
performances, so I've been following them
around and listening to them play.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0200>But it's not just for fun. I've undertaken
this important duty so I can report my
findings to President Hudson!<sp:0:4:0>You should get comfortable and take a
listen for yourself.
Talk51:
<sp:3:0:2:0201>And so...


<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughL><sp:0:2:2:7d00>I shall continue to support him!<sp:0:2:2:6400>
Talk03:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>That was brilliant! I would have never
thought of it.
CompTalk07:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000><snd:LaughS>The way they play is so incredible, I almost forget
that it's snowing.<sp:0:4:0>How I wish President Hudson could hear this...<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
Talk52:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>President Hudson, <sp:5:0:0>now you can stand
just fine without my support!
Talk53:
<sp:3:0:2:0200>It's unforgivable for even one of these
to fall over.
Talk05:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive>Now I can go to other places to put up
more signs!
CompTalk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:QuestionNormal>What do you want? <sp:5:0:0>My heart is pounding
with President Hudson's窶能u003csp:0:4:0>Or rather, <sp:5:1:0>Beetz's thundering percussion!<sp:0:4:0>So stop throwing me off my groove!
Talk54:
<sp:3:0:2:0200>It's unforgivable for even one of these
to fall over, even in rainy weather!
CompTalk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:QuestionNormal>Yes? What is it? <sp:5:0:0>I'm busy having my
spirits lifted by President Hudson's窶能u003csp:0:4:0>I mean,<sp:5:1:0> by Pyper's jaunty flute playing.<sp:0:4:0>So stop dragging me back to earth!
Talk55:
<sp:3:0:2:0101>She placed him in charge of putting the
material caches all over Hyrule. And now
he's shouldering the land's restoration!
CompTalk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:QuestionNormal>Huh? Why're you bothering me? <sp:5:0:0>I'm all
fired up by President Hudson's窶能u003csp:0:4:0>Er, I mean, <sp:5:1:0>by Eustus's wild horn playing!<sp:0:4:0>So could you go bug someone else?
Talk56:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>No need to worry that I might suffer in
this cold. I've eaten a special rice ball I
made that helps me withstand it.
CompTalk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:QuestionNormal_00>Oh, my pose?<sp:5:1:0> Truth be told, when I stand
like this...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy><sp:0:2:2:7d00>I feel completely at ease!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000>It's as if I can feel President Hudson
nearby, watching over me.<sp:0:4:0>It also makes me feel like I'm really
supporting the Stable Trotters!<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100>Ha! Don't worry. This time, I can provide
support without your help!
Talk10:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Still, thanks to you, I don't need to
support this sign anymore.
Talk57:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>No need to worry that I might suffer in
this heat. I've eaten a special rice ball I
made that helps me withstand it.
Talk09:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>Also... You must be hungry after all that
hard work, right? Let me give you a little
something I made myself!
Talk58:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I've eaten a special rice ball I made so
this cold weather won't get to me.
Talk11:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Ah, but I still don't feel like I've thanked
you enough!<sp:0:4:0>This is a little something from my premium
collection. A special gift from me to you!
Talk59:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>I've eaten a special rice ball I made so
this heat won't get to me.
Talk12:
<sp:3:0:2:0500>Hm? <sp:5:0:0>Am I窶能u003csp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseL><sp:0:2:2:7d00>I am! I'm all out of signs!<sp:0:2:2:6400><sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0b01>I...<sp:5:1:0> I did it! I've finally spread the legend
of President Hudson all across the land!
Talk13:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>But it wasn't just me. I couldn't have done
it without you!<sp:0:4:0>No matter where I found myself, you were
there to keep President Hudson窶能u003csp:5:0:0>or his
signs窶敗tanding.
<sp:3:0:2:0400>There's no doubt about it窶輩ou truly
admire President Hudson!<sp:0:4:0><sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0100><clr:0200>Though still not as much as I do...<sp:0:4:0><clr:ffff><sp:0:2:2:6400>I'm giving you a very special present to
thank you for all you've done. I'm sure
you'll love it!<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:0:2:2:6400>
